text: Hating? I am pointing out that the move to the upside might be an overaction based on the size of the buyback relative to market cap. Chill, dude.
$MSFT's $60 billion buyback pales in comparison to its $2.2 trillion market cap. Under 3% of the float. The shares are +$5 and probably a good short rental in the afterhours.
Kick save! Mr. Softee announces a $60 billion repurchase. $MSFT
$SPRT is a farce. Most meme stocks are farces. $HOOD and the Apes are doomed. Buying gewgaws is a mug's game. They should have all learned from their SPAC experience.

Coming up on @TSTRMPro Fear and Loathing On Wall Street * We remain in a 'Bull Market In Complacency' * There is certainty and precision of the bullish consensus despite a wide range of possible market and economic outcomes - many of which are adverse and market unfriendly

* A deeper than expected (and "inconceivable") market drawdown may be growing more likely * Many make the case that stocks are inexpensive to an another, overvalued asset class (bonds) - that makes little sense to me (particularly at current equity valuations)

* Legacy financials, asset gatherers and retailers are among the most vulnerable market sectors “No sympathy for the devil; keep that in mind. Buy the ticket, take the ride...and if it occasionally gets a little heavier than what you had in mind, well...

maybe chalk it up to forced consciousness expansion: Tune in, freak out, get beaten.” ― Hunter S. Thompson, Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas @tomkeene @lisaabramowicz1 @ferrotv @jimcramer @SquawkCNBC @riskreversal @ScottWapnerCNBC @guyadami @joeterranova @carlquintanilla

@tomkeene @ferrotv @lisaabramowicz1 Record high stock prices, a generational low in interest rates and extreme valuations are the fertile ground for bogus and new narratives and paradigms. Its the polar opposite of the dire pessimism of March 2009. Go Yankees!

@tomkeene We are in a "Bull Market in Complacency." Despite a wide range of possible market and economic outcomes the bullish consensus believes this all ends well. Their forecasts are optimistic and precise. The S&P is but -1.5% from an all time high. . @business @ferrotv
